title: @Riot: Leona is the latest champ you've "Sejuani'd" and it's time to fix it.
body: Now that we've nerfed the actual problem (aftershock nerfs + nerfs to early game resolve strength) can we revert some of those now unnecessary Leona nerfs? Because no matter what stats site you choose to use, her stats range from mediocre to terrible. She's now worse off than she was before the rune update. Her winrate doesn't even reach 50% in bronze and silver where she's most effective and it only gets worse the higher elo you go. This is a clear case of a champion being "Sejauni'd" and should not be ignored.

replies.body: But whenever Leona's too strong she just kills someone off of a single engage. Shit's mad annoying.
You know what's more annoying? Being an all in support that loses to sustain supports unless they play like complete morons.
Well take electrocute instead of aftershock and burst the support...

Then you're too squishy to actually fight in lane. As for op.gg, that's about as high as her winrate goes, and given how aggressive and early game centric the KR server is, 50% is pretty low for her. Most servers have her significantly lower.

You arent karma or lulu, extended trading isnt in leonas favour.

Besides the person you and your adc just focused will likely be dead anyway
Short trades aren't in Leona's favor at the moment either because they nerfed her damage too much. They then nerfed her early tankiness as well via the nerfs to resolve, and now she sucks.

We talked about her and Rammus yesterday in planning for 8.9 as two of the notable folks who are now sitting (likely) a little lower than they could be. We're thinking about some potentially small stuff to them this patch. I think we need to be careful with Leona though, she goes from "meh she's ok" to "wtf did that Leo just solo me" pretty quick.

On a related note.  It's telling that he used the phrase “Sejuani'd”.  She went from Pick/Ban in LCS and pretty good in solo queue to possibly balanced for LCS and gutted in solo queue.

After removing tracker's knife, I feel like she started to be balanced and I think the problem was more that LCS doesn't reward riskier junglers as much as they rewarded Sej, but, right now, she's a really poor choice below diamond.  Can we look at how to fix her without making her OP in the LCS?

I actually touched a bit on this topic in another post on the boards - [this one here](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/1UbZdRKB-i-really-dont-give-a-damn-about-lcs-balance?comment=0018)

I think it's highly likely that we take another look at Sej to try to better carve out her niche and better define what exactly she should be good at, and what she shouldn't be. I'd like us to not have to leave her in this state lest she become pick ban in pro again, but I don't have any concrete plans to share at the moment.

When you do that can you consider what her old niche was from before her rework? As someone who mained Sej pre rework it sucks that Riot basically did a complete 180 on how she played.

Before the rework she was a teamfight focused AoE tank who relied heavily on sustained AoE damage with below average CC, terrible single target lockdown for a tank and below average durability.

Post the rework she's a skirmished focused single target lockdown tank who deals all of her damage in single target bust with great durability and absurd CC but generally lacking damage.

The rework is just so antithetical to what Sejuani was.

One of the directions we were looking to pull back on was her single target lockdown (E into Ult or Ult into E) with the changes in 8.7. I'm hoping that the change gives us room to buff her elsewhere (either W or Q potentially). I wouldn't be surprised if she still has too much burst through her passive and could see that being another area to pull back on to put power somewhere else. If you were to change her, how would you? I may not be able to reply to your reply, but you can be guaranteed that I'll read it over the next day or two.

I don't think you can salvage this rework in a way that will make me enjoy her again. I enjoyed old Sejuani because she was a high damage tank that could make game altering plays with her ult, but like LankPants said, she's a completely different champion now. New Sejuani feels like a more aggressive version of Braum whose job is mainly to support her allies, which is an enormous departure from the juggertank hybrid she was before. I don't even mind that new Sejuani exists as a champion, but I hate that old Sejuani had to disappear for it to happen. Old Sej was my go to jungler due to her combination of carry potential and playmaking ability; new Sej is just plain boring and lacks personal agency.

The first thing I'd do is consider a full or partial revert, because the current state of her E, passive and ultimate doesn't seem tenable to me. The biggest problem with her kit is the pattern introduced by her E and her passive burst.

Short of reverts I think ultimately her E as a spell is going to have to see major changes. The current iteration just won't ever work for a kit that's focused around anything other than single target lockdown.

For me I think the ideal changes long term would be

* remove the burst part of Sejuani's passive
* rework E into a sort of combo of old E and old, old W, something like Sej (not melee allies) applies stacks as she damages targets, upon casting E she slows based off stacks and gains an AoE around her dealing damage over time to enemies based off the number of stacks.
* rework ult into a slow field that stuns enemies Sej attacks on top of it rather than the current ult

In the short term I think pulling a lot of power out of her passive damage, removing her ability for allies to stack her E, adding a lot of power to W, swapping its damage type over to magic to fix up some of her current issues with late game scaling and possibly reverting some of the Q CD nerfs could all be very positive changes.

Also thanks for being willing to talk, because I think this is the first time I've seen Riot say anything about the state of Sejuani since her rework and I think it's always been pretty bad TBH.

Just as a final cliff note, R>E isn't a thing, you can't do it. E>R is, R>E isn't.

Also adding my two sense (hope it isn't annoying) since Sej is my other go to Freljord champ, I agree with others in that I liked her old play pattern of an AOE soft CC damage tank. Her current burst pattern while sure it works does feel kinda bad. I've had low health and just using an E R combo on someone to melt them feels bad. Like I don't deserve to do that much damage as a full tank. But her old W I actually really liked because it let you get Rylais and Sunfire to spec into this soft CC AOE tank that would wade through a fight and just chase people down. 

I think an option to look at would be to remove a large part of her passive damage, and instead do something like this.

W works as is

E, allies no longer stack it, however E active now works like old W, and at max stacks enemies are slowed for a large amount for 1 second or so, say 50% slow. This would make her more about staying on enemies to apply her stacks and turning a soft slown of say 10% into 50%, which makes her play more as the CC tank she should be rather than the tank that waits for her passive, nukes someone, then runs to wait for passive. I understand her old pattern felt a bit uninteresting but a lot of Sejuani players seemed to like it and other Rioters have said that in cases like Malphite sometimes simple champions with not much depth are okay for the game. If Malph is healthy as an R bot why can't Sej be healthy as an AOE soft CC tank?

Which would leave her a potato in lane unable to punish enemies for being out of position. Unable to sustain through enemy poke which is nigh constant vs a ranged support. Fewer opportunities to engage vs an enemy melee. If anything, remove her passive and give her a better one. Removing her ability to engage in lane - especially pre lvl-6 just makes her far too easily abused; that's exactly what you would be doing by nerfing her e or increasing it's cd. If she can't engage, she has nothing. No q or w buff aside from a drastic change (which would probably need to be at broken level to make up for the e nerf) is going to make up for that. She wouldn't be able to USE any of those buffs except when she already got off her engage via her e.

So either you are increasing the window of safety for her opponents between her e's but hella buffing her q or w to give her more burst or nigh invulnerability (via q or w buff) when she does get off her e engage; or... you are leaving her with a buff she cannot use basically at all in lane which will leave her too far behind and abused from laning phase to make use of it later in the game... and consequently her adc as well.

If you are going to nerf anything (and honestly look at the stupidity of taric's damage and cc plus his much better scaling both as an individual and for teamfights before you make changes and consider that among other things), then nerf/change her passive. Replace it with something that would make her more durable/extend the duration of her durability (like some minor %hp shielding for landing w damage onto enemy champ) or give her some kind of movespeed bonus in certain situations from her passive (instead of the damage it does) to allow her potential to engage with her q even if e is on cd.

There are champs far more "busted" than leona - even when she was "broken" earlier this season. And many of those have gone untouched or even buffed because they are countered hard in high elo. If leona is "broken" in low elo, so what - there's a million other champs that are too. People have a "ban" button for it if they can't play against it. No different than me having to ban a singed or a master yi some games just because my teammates cannot handle playing against it. And those champs can be far more oppressive than leona ever has been.

Stop punishing early game champs for doing their job properly. I don't see you nerfing yi, fiora, soraka, or tahm for how oppressive they can be outside of lane or even in lane. Yet they're allowed to compete on near equal footing with early game champs unless the early game champ outplays them and snowballs lane - note I said OUTPLAY. Because if they don't, the scaling champ goes even in lane and just far outpaces. Let the early game champs do their job and be BULLIES in the early game like they're supposed to be. Or else, stop giving scaling champs such a strong scaling advantage; make THEM have to outplay mid/late to be better than the early game champ... not someone who can just rely on better item synergy, better scaling kit, or pure out-stat to demolish an opponent mid/late. There's too damn much of this going on... across the roles of league - not just support, and not just toplane.

Hi Maple! I believe that her passive is the most problematic aspect of her kit. She can't use the passive herself and is one of the few champions in the game that doesn't have a passive unless her teammates damage the same target she is attacking. Even braum can proc his own passive as a support. 

If you do reduce her ability to lock down a target by raising cooldowns her passive should be examined or her durability should be assessed. Leona always tips from being overbearing when she is too strong to largely irrelevant because she has no way out after a fight. 

I think Riot should ask this question when trying to balance Leona: **"Why would a player pick Leona if they can just play Braum?"
**
They have pretty similar kits but Braum has an escape and Leona doesn't. So her CC needs to be much stronger than Braum's or her durability needs to be much higher than Braum's.  I like playing Leona sometimes at support because she is simple, but it is hard to justify the pick over other champions at this point that are more effective.

This is what really gets my goat. In the past, Riot's reworks have all been about sharpening a champs identity in new and interesting ways while adding more gameplay. They've generally done a pretty good job of this and I've been one of the biggest defenders of Riot's reworks for that reason. Riot only changed the core gameplay/playstyle of a champion when the old way was unsustainable, i.e. Poppy, Sion, Yorick, etc. Riot apparently considered Sejuani to be one of the champions needing a drastic change, but I just don't see it. Old Sej had some problems but new Sej has been an even bigger problem while being less fun.

>They've generally done a pretty good job of this and I've been one of the biggest defenders of Riot's reworks for that reason.

There's a duality you're missing here. Riot's focused, single champion small reworks and VGUs have generally been very good, especially over the last few years. Their multi-champion class updates have been overwhelmingly terrible. There are so many bad class reworks, Kog, Graves, Garen, Sej, Syndra, Zyra, Zac, Rengar, LB ect. Sej is just part of the fallout from a system that failed.

I would actually defend most of those. I think the adc update is among the best work Riot has ever done and I think that every champ that was part of it is better now than they were before. The only question mark among them for me is Graves, but I think that new Graves is interesting and fun enough to justify the changes he was given. I do understand why old Graves players are salty about it though. I also consider the juggernaut rework a huge success, with Darius being the clear winner, Morde a bit behind him, and then Garen and Skarner taking up the rear. I still consider Garen better than before; my only problem with new Garen is how his E damage early game is pathetically low for absolutely no reason. I also consider the new items as part of these class updates, and both the juggernaut and adc updates changed items in a very positive way. 

The mage updates are a bit messier, but I'm generally positive about them. I like how Malzahar. Brand, Vlad, Cass, and Vel'koz turned out; Zyra seems more or less the same and I was a fan of all the smaller changes to some champs, such as Xerath's new ult, Zigg's W tower destruction, Annie's new Tibbers, and Anivia's new ult. 

The assassin update is where I start to agree. 100% on board with Talon and Katarina who are both far better than they were before. The Leblanc and Rengar updates were both garbage, but so were their original designs. Akali got a lot more agency, but this just made her incredibly obnoxious to lane against as a melee champ, so I call that one neutral. 

The tank updates were definitely the most questionable ones. I still think that no champion should have as much CC as Zac does, and I don't even understand what the point of the Maokai rework was. Sejuani got the worst of it though. The tank update was supposed to be about differentiating tanks, but not only did they fail at that, but they actually homogenized her while making her less fun to play. One of their stated goals was to distribute power more evenly across her kit rather than concentrating it in her ult. They just put all the power in E instead, and made it highly conditional power. How exactly is that better? To note, I consider her passive burst as part of her E given that she needs to proc E to get that damage. Sej's Q, W, and ult all had to lose power for that stupid E which isn't even satisfying to use. Worst of all, she's been a balance nightmare since the rework, so it hasn't even been a success from a game health standpoint.

Can you fix Conditioning for this case? Leona's W doesn't stack with it. http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Conditioning 
unless it got hiddenly  fixed
Maybe you could try giving her a unique mechanic something to protect allies with while shifting around her power from elsewhere?

Leona doesn't need more damage. She needs... to have guaranteed engage off landing her e - not stuff that can be easily interrupted by a skilled janna, thresh, or alistar. She needs more durability; she's less tanky than most other melee supports w/o items despite the fact that she has to take as much or MORE risk than them to engage while also lacking any form of sustain for herself or her teammates aside from runes and items.

Thresh - less risk when fishing for combo's, can't be countered the same way leona can.
Tahm - counters leona's cc, does more damage via his slow, his stupid high aa damage, and his devour damage. If the enemy is smart enough to stand and trade with you, you definitely lose out on the trade no matter how well you landed and layered your cc. Also, tahm has more sustain vs harass.
Braum - again, similar to tahm; either the enemy adc is forced to run away, or you severely lose the trade thanks to braum q slow and passive... not to mention his shield. Furthermore, braum has no NEED to win lane compared to leona's need to snowball.  Also, braum is arguably tankier. Finally, he has ranged harass via his q and ability to stack passive off that while leona has... none.
Karma - similar level of damage to leona combo, none of the risk of that kind of engage. Can stun enemies who try to continue an engage and heal off it.
Raka - less burst, but makes up for it with sustained harass via auto's and q's... which also heals her. Heals teammate too which gives them more sustain and means they have 0 pressure/need to win lane. Can screw up enemy engages easily via her q slow/heal and her silence which turns the engage back around on the aggressor. And seeing how the enemy aggressor is almost certainly melee, they can easily end up creep blocked and eat the stun/snare from her silence until they get boots.
Alistar - harder to counter his initial engage. Better sustain. Tankier level 6+. No need to play agro and get ahead; can just scale.
Blitz - no need to put one's self at risk to engage; just bring enemy to you. This makes you far safer to enemy jg ganks and have less to worry about when considering an "engage". Also, can arguably abuse tower damage early much better than leona; enemies can't play too agro vs you by your tower.
You start to see the picture? More reliable engage off her e; shouldn't be interrupted by crap like thresh flay or janna tornado for how much of a risk she's taking and how long she loses any threat to enemy bot duo for "missing" her engage. More tanky than other supports due to having to put herself at greater risk than other supports to do anything and due to her innate lack of sustain compared to almost every other support. That's what leona needs. Not more damage; durability, reliable engage.

Any medium-to-long-term plans about Leona's kit? It seems the reason why she varies between those two states is because she's binary by nature. Either she dives her target and they die, or she dives and loses the trade hard. There isn't much in-between or ways to express skill with her kit.

With the new talk about making champions more viable in alternate positions like with Vi going top, do you guys gave any work planned for champions like Leona or Braum who some may want to play as full tanks but not in the support role? Or are you still in the early stages where you might not want some champions to be playable outside their one role? Leo is a champ I love and do enjoy taking top lane in normals from time to time but it's very much not optimal and I know other Leona players also enjoy her in a solo lane.

Nuts to that. Leona should be a Triforce bruiser, not another full tank. She's almost there now; just needs to tweaks to make her laning more tolerable and some kind of steroid so her DPS doesn't fall off so hard.
That's a matter of subject. She could realistically be played as both since she's a tank support.

In addition to someone else asking for Leona solo lane improvements, would you consider Leona proccing her passive damage on (maybe only large) jungle monsters herself? With this she might be able to jungle reasonably well, and I would love to play some jungle Leona from time to time without feeling sorry for my laners that they have to suck up my low clear speed (didn't do it in quite some time).

That's because too many supports have way too much damage in their kits. If every support had slightly lower damage in the early game, they wouldn't be able to solo the enemy ADC, and they would be balanced compared to the other supports. Leona isn't supposed to kill you, she's supposed to lock you down and tank damage. Alistar is the same. And yet both have been able to solo kill ADCs and non-tank supports since preseason. For months now, Janna W max with comet has just pushed people out of bot lane after 3-4 bits of harass, or they're zoned anyway and the result is about the same. Lulu, Nami, and Morgana are almost as bad.

I know there are Janna nerfs on the PBE. But fixing Janna is not enough to fix the state of the game. Support has been broken for a long time now.

I know it will almost certainly never happen, but I would like if they made her more of a fighter/support hybrid that can go either support or top the way Tahm, Shen, Nautilus, and Taric can. Leona is the vision of a warrior, but her dueling is piss poor, and not just because of how her passive works. A complete lack of sustain, anti-tank damage, ranged farming, and a damage steroid make her a terrible 1v1 champ despite carrying around a sword that should be able to kill motherfuckers. I want Leona to be a team oriented fighter that can hold her own 1v1 instead of a tank that needs to be on her teams hip to do anything. Might seem impossible, but Riot has shown that it can be done multiple times already.

I also would very much enjoy if Leona was reworked into the carry of bot lane instead of the support. Putting Leona bot as the "adc" with an AP support has already shown some promise in my testing and I would love for Leona to be the first tank botlane carry.
